meanings.definition: A white crystalline powder used in curing meat.
meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled nitre on the meat to help preserve it.
meanings.sent2: The nitre added to the meat helped it stay fresh longer.
meanings.sent3: The nitre danced on the meat, making it last longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The nitre worked like magic, keeping the meat from spoiling.
meanings.sent5: The white powder of nitre coated the meat, acting as a protective shield against decay.

meanings.definition: A mineral form of potassium nitrate.
meanings.sent1: Miners discovered a vein of nitre deep underground.
meanings.sent2: The nitre found in the cave was a valuable mineral.
meanings.sent3: The nitre in the rock sparkled like precious gems.
meanings.sent4: The nitre deposits were like hidden treasures waiting to be unearthed.
meanings.sent5: The miners carefully extracted the nitre from the earth, marveling at its beauty.

meanings.definition: To treat or preserve with nitre.
meanings.sent1: The butcher decided to nitre the meat to extend its shelf life.
meanings.sent2: She nitred the food to keep it fresh for a longer period.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would nitre everything in the fridge to stop time.
meanings.sent4: The preservation process nitred the food, locking in its flavor.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully nitred the ingredients, ensuring they would last for days to come.
